content: The amendment to Section 233(e) of the Act allows agreements to enter into force after 60 days of transmittal to Congress, excluding certain days. The President's report supporting the agreement is sent to Congress, with copies delivered to both Houses on the same day. The document must include a determination by the Chief Actuary of the Social Security Administration regarding the agreement's impact over a 75-year period. The President's report on the agreement is submitted to Congress, including the Chief Actuary's assessment of its impact on the social security system over a 75-year period. This assessment involves a net reduction in the system's actuarial balance by at least 0.005 percent of the present value of taxable payroll. The term 'taxable payroll' refers to total wages and self-employment income for a period. The term 'adjusted summarized income rate' is the ratio of trust fund balance plus total income from taxes to taxable payroll for a period. The term 'trust fund balance' refers to the combined balance of the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund and the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund. The term 'income from taxes' refers to amounts deposited in the Trust Funds based on taxes under specific sections of the Internal Revenue Code. The term 'cost' refers to disbursements from the Trust Funds, including benefit payments and special monthly payments to certain uninsured individuals. The curr_chunk discusses various financial aspects of the Trust Funds, including coverage, administrative expenses, net transfers, payments for vocational rehabilitation services, and target trust fund balance. The curr_chunk discusses the trust fund balance needed to support a 100 percent trust fund ratio for the year following a 75-year period. The Chief Actuary uses the intermediate assumptions of the Board of Trustees for determinations. An agreement under this section will not take effect if certain conditions are met. The curr_chunk discusses the conditions for an agreement to take effect, including a net reduction in the actuarial balance of the social security system. The curr_chunk outlines the conditions for an agreement to come into effect, requiring a minimum reduction in the actuarial balance of the social security system. Additionally, it specifies that the agreement must be approved by a bill or joint resolution within 60 days. During the 60-day period, it is a privilege for each House of Congress to consider a bill or joint resolution related to the agreement's approval, with recognition of the constitutional right to change House rules. During the 60-day period, each House of Congress has the privilege to consider a bill or joint resolution for the approval or disapproval of an agreement. The agreement cannot be amended after being transmitted to each House of Congress. The amendment made by this subsection applies to agreements establishing certain provisions. The amendment made by this subsection applies to agreements establishing totalization arrangements between the social security system of the US and another country, transmitted to Congress after the enactment of this Act. The agreement between the US social security system and another country, signed in June 2004 and transmitted to Congress after September 1, 2007, shall not enter into force until specified in section 233(e) of the Act. The Act is amended to treat agreements as if they were transmitted to Congress when the President submits a report supporting the agreement. Additionally, biennial reports to Congress regarding ongoing operation of Totalization Agreements are required. "Biennial Oversight Reports are mandated to be submitted to Congress regarding the ongoing operation of Totalization Agreements." The Commissioner of Social Security must submit biennial reports to Congress evaluating the operation of Totalization Agreements, including the change in benefit costs under the social security system. The biennial reports to Congress evaluate Totalization Agreements, including changes in benefit costs and potential fraudulent receipt of benefits. Information on integrity issues with the other country's data is also included. The Commissioner of Social Security is required to submit biennial reports to Congress on Totalization Agreements, including information on demographic trends that may impact cost estimates to social security systems. The initial report must be submitted by December 31, 2008. SEC. 203. SUSPENSION OF BENEFITS FOR INDIVIDUALS REMOVED FROM THE UNITED STATES. Amendment to Section 202(n)(1) of the Social Security Act prohibits lump sum death payments to individuals removed from the United States upon notification by the Attorney General or Secretary of Homeland Security. The amendments made by this section apply to individuals removed from the United States after notification by the Attorney General or Secretary of Homeland Security.
